citation.article-title: Reclassification of marine Agrobacterium species: Proposals of Stappia stellulata gen. nov., comb. nov., Stappia aggregata sp. nov., nom. rev., Ruegeria atlantica gen. nov., comb. nov., Ruegeria gelatinovora comb. nov., Ruegeria algicola comb. nov., and Ahrensia kieliense gen. nov., sp. nov., nom. rev.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Ruegeria (Rueger.ia. M.L. ending -ia; M.L. fem. n. Ruegeria, honoring Rueger, a German microbiologist, for his contribution to the taxonomy of marine species of Agrobacterium)
The cells are gram-negative ovoid shape or rods 0.6 to 1.6 μm wide and 1.0 to 4.0 μm long, and they do not form spores.
They are motile or nonmotile, and the motile strains are motile by means of a polar flagella.
They are oxidase- and catalase-positive, and they grow aerobically.
The G+C content of the DNA is 55 to 59 mol%.
The type species is Ruegeria atlantica.
